Output¶

By the Model class¶

class model.Model(mesh, out_dir='./results/', order=1, use_periodic=False, **kwargs)[source]

The basic model from which each of these inherit :

  • LatModel - plane strain model
  • D1Model - 1D firn model
  • D2Model - 2D model (SSA, SIA, balance velocity)
  • D3Model - 3D model (first-order, full-Stokes)
Parameters:
  • mesh (Mesh) – the finite-element mesh
  • out_dir (string) – location for the output directory
  • order (int) – order of the shape function basis, default linear
  • use_periodic (bool) – use periodic boundaries or not
save_hdf5(u, f, name=None)[source]

Save a Function u to the .h5 file f in the hdf5 subdirectory of self.out_dir. If name = None, this will save the flie under u.name().

Parameters:
  • u (Constant, Function, or GenericVector) – the function to save
  • f (HDF5File) – the file to save to
save_list_to_hdf5(lst, h5File)[source]

save a list of functions or coefficients lst to hdf5 file h5File.

Parameters:
  • lst – list
  • h5File (HDF5File) – the file to save to
save_matlab(u, di, filename, val=2.718281828459045)[source]

Create Matlab version 4 file output of regular gridded data contained by f. Currently, this function only works for 2D \(x,y\)-plane data.

Parameters:
  • u (Function or GenericVector) – a Function, to be mapped onto the regular grid used by di
  • di – a DataInput object
  • filename (string) – filename to save as
  • val (float) – value to make values outside of mesh, default \(e\)
Return type:

MatLab file <self.out_dir>/matlab/<filename>.mat.
save_mesh(h5File)[source]

save the mesh self.mesh to HDF5File h5File.

Parameters:h5File (HDF5File) – the file to save to
save_subdomain_data(h5File)[source]

Save the subdomain self.ff, self.ff_acc, and self.cf to hd5f file h5File.

Parameters:h5File (HDF5File) – the file to save to
save_xdmf(u, name, f=None, t=0.0)[source]

Save a XDMFFile with name name of the Function u to the xdmf directory specified by self.out_dir.

If f is a XDMFFile object, save to this instead.

If t is a float or an int, mark the file with the timestep t.

Parameters:
  • u (Function or GenericVector) – the function to save
  • name – the name of the .xdmf file to save
  • f (XDMFFile) – the file to save to
  • t (int or float) – the timestep to mark the file with

Printing text data to the screen¶

inputoutput.print_min_max(u, title, color='97', cls=None)[source]¶

Print the minimum and maximum values of u, a Vector, Function, or array.

Parameters:
  • u (GenericVector, ndarray, Function, int, float, Constant) – the variable to print the min and max of
  • title (string) – the name of the function to print
  • color (string) – the color of printed text
inputoutput.get_text(text, color=None, atrb=0, cls=None)[source]¶

Returns text text from calling class cls for printing at a later time.

Parameters:
  • text (string) – the text to print
  • color (string) – the color of the text to print
  • atrb (int) – attributes to send use by colored package
  • cls (object) – the calling class
inputoutput.print_text(text, color=None, atrb=0, cls=None)[source]¶

Print text text from calling class cls to the screen.

Parameters:
  • text (string) – the text to print
  • color (string) – the color of the text to print
  • atrb (int) – attributes to send use by colored package
  • cls (object) – the calling class

Plot geographic results¶

helper.plotIce(di, u, name, direc, u2=None, u2_levels=None, u2_color='k', u2_linewidth=1.0, title='', cmap='gist_yarg', scale='lin', umin=None, umax=None, numLvls=12, drawGridLabels=True, levels=None, levels_2=None, tp=False, tpAlpha=0.5, contour_type='filled', params=None, extend='neither', show=True, ext='.pdf', res=150, cb=True, cb_format='%.1e', zoom_box=False, zoom_box_kwargs=None, plot_pts=None, plot_texts=None, plot_continent=False, cont_plot_params=None, drawcoastlines=True, box_params=None)[source]¶

Args:

di:DataInput object with desired projection
u:solution to plot; can be either a function on a 2D mesh, or a string key to matrix variable in di.data.
name:title of the plot, latex accepted
direc:directory string location to save image.
cmap:colormap to use - see images directory for sample and name
scale:scale to plot, either ‘log’, ‘lin’, or ‘bool’
numLvls:number of levels for field values
levels:manual levels, if desired.
tp:boolean determins plotting of triangle overlay
tpAlpha:alpha level of triangles 0.0 (transparent) - 1.0 (opaque)
extends:for the colorbar, extend upper range and may be [“neither”, “both”, “min”, “max”]. default is “neither”.

for plotting the zoom-box, make zoom_box = True and supply dict zoom_box_kwargs with parameters

zoom:ammount to zoom
loc:location of box
loc1:loc of first line
loc2:loc of second line
x1:first x-coord
y1:first y-coord
x2:second x-coord
y2:second y-coord
scale_font_color:
 scale font color
scale_length:scale length in km
scale_loc:1=top, 2=bottom
plot_grid:plot the triangles
axes_color:color of axes
plot_points:dict of points to plot

Returns:

A sigle direc/name.ext in the source directory.

Plot mathematical results¶

helper.plot_variable(u, name, direc, figsize=(8, 7), cmap='gist_yarg', scale='lin', numLvls=12, levels=None, levels_2=None, umin=None, umax=None, vec_scale=None, tp=False, tpAlpha=0.5, show=True, hide_ax_tick_labels=False, xlabel='$x$', ylabel='$y$', equal_axes=True, title='', hide_axis=False, colorbar_loc='right', contour_type='filled', extend='neither', ext='.pdf', res=150, cb=True, cb_format='%.1e')[source]
